protocol_CHEST.indications: Evaluation of chest wall/mediastinal masses, brachial plexus pathology, thoracic outlet syndrome
protocol_CHEST.contrast_rationale: Contrast needed to assess mass enhancement characteristics and vascular involvement
scanner_notes: Include lung apices through diaphragm
Include both axillae and shoulder regions for brachial plexus evaluation
Ensure thoracic inlet well covered on coronal sequences
Respiratory gating recommended for mediastinal sequences

protocol_CHEST W/O.indications: Chest wall evaluation, rib lesion assessment, sternal abnormality
scanner_notes: Ensure complete coverage of chest wall and ribs
Center to area of concern if specified in requisition
Use respiratory gating when possible
Consider cardiac gating for anterior chest wall

protocol_CARDIAC STRESS.indications: Evaluation for myocardial ischemia under pharmacologic stress
protocol_CARDIAC STRESS.contrast_rationale: Gadolinium required for first-pass perfusion imaging and late gadolinium enhancement
scanner_notes: Ensure IV access with two lines - one for contrast, one for stress agent
Monitor ECG throughout exam
Have resuscitation equipment readily available
Coordinate with pharmacist/nurse for stress agent administration
Ensure patient NPO for 12 hours from caffeine

protocol_WHOLE BODY.indications: Screening for metastatic disease, multiple myeloma, systemic conditions
protocol_WHOLE BODY.contrast_rationale: Non-contrast protocol sufficient for screening. STIR and DWI provide excellent lesion detection.
scanner_notes: Use body coil and surface coils as needed for coverage
Perform in segments with table movement
Include skull vertex to mid-thigh
Optimize DWI for bone marrow assessment
Total scan time approximately 45 minutes

protocol_WHOLE BODY +C.indications: Oncologic staging, evaluation for metastatic disease, lymphoma assessment, and tumor surveillance
protocol_WHOLE BODY +C.contrast_rationale: Contrast required for detection of enhancing lesions and improved characterization of metastatic disease
scanner_notes: Ensure complete coverage from skull base to mid-thigh
Use body coil with table movement for whole body coverage
Optimize DWI parameters to minimize distortion
Post-contrast timing: 3-5 minutes after injection

protocol_MR ARTHROGRAM.indications: Evaluate for internal derangement, labral pathology, cartilage defects, and ligamentous injury after intra-articular contrast administration
protocol_MR ARTHROGRAM.contrast_rationale: Intra-articular gadolinium provides detailed assessment of labral tears, cartilage defects and ligament injuries by outlining joint structures
scanner_notes: Ensure contrast is properly injected under fluoroscopic guidance before MRI
Begin scanning within 30 minutes of contrast injection
Use dedicated joint coil
Thin slice thickness (3mm or less)
Patient should limit joint movement between injection and scanning

protocol_MR ENTEROGRAPHY.indications: Evaluation of small bowel inflammation, Crohn's disease activity, and complications
protocol_MR ENTEROGRAPHY.contrast_rationale: IV contrast needed to assess bowel wall enhancement, inflammation, and complications
scanner_notes: Ensure patient has fasted 6 hours prior
Administer oral contrast (VoLumen or similar) 45-60 min before scan
Use respiratory triggering for motion compensation
Consider anti-peristaltic agent if needed

protocol_MR DEFECOGRAPHY.indications: Evaluation of pelvic floor dysfunction, including prolapse, rectocele, and defecation disorders
protocol_MR DEFECOGRAPHY.contrast_rationale: Contrast not required for functional assessment of pelvic floor dynamics
scanner_notes: Position patient supine with adequate gel in rectum
Ensure patient understands breathing and bearing down instructions
Dynamic sequences should be acquired in real-time during rest, squeeze and defecation
Use rapid acquisition for dynamic sequences
Consider using cushions for patient comfort

protocol_FETAL.indications: Fetal anatomic evaluation, CNS assessment, and placental imaging
protocol_FETAL.contrast_rationale: Contrast not indicated for fetal imaging due to safety concerns
scanner_notes: Use respiratory triggering if available
Keep scan times under 30 seconds per sequence when possible
Position coil to cover entire uterus
Consider maternal left lateral decubitus position
Repeat sequences if significant fetal motion occurs
